answerText: Gerhart Hauptmann[10] The former play by Hauptmann is about a "sunken" one of these objects. John Donne suggested that we should not ask "for whom" these objects "toll" in a line that provided the title to a Hemingway novel.
heading: Penn Bowl |2013 | 4 | 17 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In one drama by this author, Heinrich's magnum opus is lost in a lake before he falls in love with Rautendelein. [10] Name this author of another work in which Mother Wolff steals from Mr. Kruger after receiving a generous offer from Wulkow.
